The half-time whistle goes at Old Trafford and England lead 2-0 at the break via goals from Wayne Rooney and Toni Duggan.
England get a second goal. Duggan, fresh off the bench, latches onto a perfect pass from Carrick and slots it past Van der Sar.
England make another change, bringing on Farah to replace Nelson-Joyce.

Wilshere has been England's best player, regularly linking up with Rooney, and the former has just been sent free to test Van der Sar. Unfortunately for the former Arsenal man, his effort was saved and turned behind for a corner.
England make another couple of changes;
OFF: Brooker & Scott
ON: Lewis & Duggan
The fans gathered in the Sir Alex Ferguson Stand have just produced the first Mexican wave of the evening. It wouldn't be Soccer Aid without one of those, would it?
That was outstanding from Angry Ginge, who gets himself back on the line to hook an effort from Rivaldo away.
Meanwhile, Ramsey has now gone off for England.
Former United defender O'Shea has just come on for the World XI, replacing Kewell, who started at left-back.
England have dominated the game so far and have enjoyed plenty of possession in the World XI's half. Rooney has been a real bright spark so far, showing all his years worth of experience.
England have made a bright start here and go close to a second through Grennan, who curls an effort over the bar from distance.
Meanwhile, the World XI have been forced into a change already, with Bellew being forced off with an apparent injury. He has been replaced by Marquez.
What a start for England! Van der Sar and Vidic fail to deal with a high cross into the box, the ball bounces around and Rooney turns it home from inside the box.
A few minutes later than scheduled, Soccer Aid 2025 is underway at Old Trafford. England are kicking towards the Stretford End in the first 45.

headline: Man United target Bryan Mbeumo refuses to address future as he breaks silence on Thomas Frank exit
body: Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo has refused to address his future this summer as he continues to be linked with a summer move to Manchester United.
United submitted an opening offer of £45million with a further £10million in add-ons for Mbeumo, but it fell short of Brentford’s valuation and talks are continuing between the clubs.
Mbeumo is thought to be keen to join the club and United would like to wrap up a deal for Mbeumo as soon as possible so he can report for the start of pre-season at Carrington in July.

But Tottenham are also interested in the Cameroon international and his relationship with his former Bees manager Thomas Frank, who has just been appointed as Spurs boss, could prove to be a crucial bargaining tool given his development under the Dane in West London.
And while being interviewed ahead of the F1 Canadian Grand Prix, Mbeumo respectfully asked not to be asked about his future this summer, but did answer questions on Frank's move to Tottenham.
"He has trusted me from the start, developed the team so well, developed me as a human and a player so much and I wish him all the best and wish he is going to do well.
"He knows everything. He is really smart, he knows where he wants to bring the team and how he wants to play and he has been fantastic for Brentford.
"He is going to have some time to adapt. He will have more games and more expectation but I am sure he is going to do well."
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

headline: Omar Berrada has already addressed the transfer concern Manchester United might be about to face
body: It has become easy to understand why Manchester United identified Liam Delap as their top striker target for this summer's transfer window, hasn't it?

Ahead of the transfer window reopening for business on Monday following a brief pause in proceedings, it already feels as though United's pursuit of a goal-getter has gone on for months. In reality, the window has only officially been open for ten days.
Nevertheless, United's pursuit of a No.9 already feels as though it has taken countless twists and turns, despite the club not yet lodging an official bid for a striker as yet.

After missing out on Delap to Chelsea, who signed him from Ipswich Town via a £30million release clause, United are being forced to look elsewhere. The England Under-21 international had scored a respectable 12 goals in his first full season in the Premier League and signing him would have been a relatively straightforward task.
Instead, United's search for a goal-getter does not currently offer an obvious answer. They are being linked with a cluster of strikers, but they are yet to table a bid for any of them.

Having signed Matheus Cunha for £62.5m and being keen on signing Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford for potentially a similar fee, funds raised from player sales will be key to United's hopes of signing the striker they so desperately crave.

United have finished each of the last two Premier League campaigns with a negative goal difference and failing to sign a striker this summer is a non-negotiable. But as they are quickly finding out, goalscorers are not easy to obtain.

Sporting Lisbon's Viktor Gyokeres and Victor Osimhen of Napoli are two of the most sought after strikers in Europe right now and both are expected to be on the move this summer. They have boasted impressive records in front of goal in recent seasons and either of them would be an excellent signing for United.

However, Gyokeres reportedly prefers a move to Arsenal over Old Trafford, and Sporting president Frederico Varandas recently quashed suggestions the striker could leave for €70m (£59m) this summer. Osimhen, meanwhile, is understood to have eye-watering wage demands.

It is no secret United, to land an elite-level striker this summer, will have to loosen their purse strings and splash the cash. However, there is a fine line between getting value for money and paying over the odds.

United have had their pants pulled down on countless occasions in recent years, and improving their success rate in the transfer market is one of Ineos' leading priorities. United's recruitment strategy has improved for the better over the last 12 months or so.
However, just as chief executive Omar Berrada warned following the conclusion of last summer's window, United cannot get back into the habit of paying over the odds for players.
"We were able to do it [the summer window] in a financially sustainable way," Berrada said last September.

"We were quite disciplined about the valuations we were giving to the players who were going to come in. We stuck to those valuations. I think [sporting director] Dan [Ashworth] and the team did a fantastic job in the negotiations process.

"The reason I mention that is if you make a mistake and if you overspend or get a player who can cost you too much, it can set you back. Which is why you need to be able to take those decisions and make the right ones consistently over time to be in a position to win consistently."

After years worth of reckless spending, United can ill-afford to undo the progressive steps that have been made over the last 12 months through sheer desperation for a goalscorer. Of course, United would love to secure the services of a new No.9 as quickly as possible, but they cannot lose sight of the finances and being sensible.

It is easy for any club to become frustrated in the pursuit of a player, particularly when their respective position is in such desperate need of fresh blood, but United have to remain disciplined in their approach for a goal-getter.

It is not impossible that either Gyokeres or Osimhen could arrive at Old Trafford at some point this summer, but the chances of them doing so looks set to boil down to who can offer the best financial package.
United do not have a bottomless pit this summer and they have already spent north of £60m on Cunha. It is obvious why Delap topped their wish list.

headline: Man United transfer news LIVE - Hugo Ekitike 'contact' made, Viktor Gyokeres boost, Garnacho exit
body: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the latest Manchester United transfer news, views and rumours on Sunday, June 15.

Even though the transfer window is closed until Monday, 16 June, The Reds are still actively pursuing targets ahead of the start of pre-season. Matheus Cunha has already arrived and there is optimism he could be followed by Bryan Mbeumo.
The Brentford star is another attacker wanted by Ruben Amorim but United have already failed with an offer worth £55m. Tottenham are now thought to have joined the race.

Viktor Gyokeres is a trending name with United, but they have been dealt a blow in that pursuit. Reports claim that the former Brighton & Hove Albion and Coventry striker would prefer a move to Arsenal.

There also remains speculation about the futures of Antony, Jadon Sancho and Marcus Rashford following their loans last season. Bruno Fernandes, meanwhile, ended rumours regarding his time at Old Trafford by turning down a lucrative move to Saudi Arabia.
Follow the latest United transfer news:
That's all for tonight.
Join us tomorrow for more transfer news as the transfer window OFFICIALLY OPENS!
The updates regarding Viktor Gyokeres never seem to end.

According to Portuguese outlet Record, Arsenal have 'frozen' their pursuit of the striker due to Sporting CP's asking price. It's claimed that a bid worth £47m plus £8.5m in add-ons has already been turned down.
Another offer from the Gunners worth £60m was then rebuffed with Sporting wanting £85m - Gyokeres' release clause.
Real Betis and Man United met to discuss Antony in England recently, according to Spanish outlet ABC.
The paper has suggested that both teams have acknowledged that a deal could take a number of weeks to finalise but it's thought Betis are 'growing optimistic' about bringing Antony back to the club.
Now then, a positive update coming out of Germany regarding Hugo Ekitike.
BILD have claimed that the Eintracht Frankfurt striker is open to joining United with it understood that they are the only club to contact Frankfurt so far.
It's said his brother and United have been in contact.
Mundo Deportivo have claimed that Aston Villa are considering selling their women's team in an attempt to sign Marcus Rashford.

Financial expert Dan Plumley has revealed that offsetting their women's team could help them bring Rashford in. Plumley has claimed Villa could look to exploit a legal loophole to free up resources to sign him.
Man United's hopes of landing an audacious move for Victor Osimhen have taken a hit.
According to Valentin Furlan and Rudy Galetti, the striker wants Champions League football after playing in the Europa League with Galatasaray season.
The journalists claim that United and AC Milan aren't thought to be the frontrunners.
Porto have joined the race to land Southampton star Tyler Dibling, according to reports in Portugal.

Record have claimed that the Portuguese side are exploring a way to make a deal happen. Dibling caught the eye from United and a number of teams in recent seasons with Chelsea, Tottenham and Bayern Munich all keen.
The report adds that Porto are exploring possible swap deals or a possible loan.
The sales of Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho, Antony and Casemiro could save Man United a sensational £90m.

That's according to former Manchester City financial advisor Stefan Borson, who claims the four exits could help United significantly balance their books. “It will make an enormous difference to Manchester United if they can remove Sancho, Antony, Casemiro and Rashford from the wage bill," he told Football Insider.

“Those players don’t play very much. Casemiro did play in the second half of the season, but generally he’s going to play less given his age. If they can remove all of those players, the total cost of those players for next season could be £80million, maybe £90million.
“That’s a huge part of their wage bill just on those four players. So, if they can get those players out the door, then the financial side of things will continue to improve."
Man United were reportedly offered Douglas Luiz in a swap deal for outcast forward Antony.

According to GIVEMESPORT, Juventus put Luiz on a table for United when former director of football, Cristiano Guintoli, was at the club. The Italian left less than a fortnight ago but it was suggested Antony was of interest.
The report claims that initial talks were held to consider the possibility of a move.
Manchester United face their most pivotal transfer window in recent memory after a disastrous campaign.

Losing the Europa League final and finishing 15th spot in the Premier League means that there will be no European football at Old Trafford for the first time in over a decade. It means United's task of rebuilding under Ruben Amorim has become that little bit harder, for multiple reasons.
And with the transfer window reopening in a couple of days, I've taken a look here at what a best-case summer would look like for Amorim and the Reds.
Former Chelsea star Florent Malouda has had his say on Jadon Sancho's struggles since moving to the Premier League.
"If you look at Jadon Sancho’s history in the Premier League, he has never really been able to express his talent as much as he did in Germany," he said via Bet365.

"In Germany, the best club for him was Dortmund, they gave him the platform to express his talent. I think the challenge for him is to be able to accommodate himself with talented players around him and see how he can develop his game, creating connections with other players.

"If he manages to do that, I think he can succeed with Manchester United. There are not so many clubs bigger than United. I'm not talking about where they stand in the league, but in terms of expectations and platform, it's one of the best clubs in the world.

"What we need to see is some type of leadership – that is a personal mindset that he needs to develop. I can’t see Sancho on another loan, I think he needs to show resilience. I think he needs to overcome his situation because he has the potential.
"Leaving is a way to escape your responsibilities. We expect more from him and he should be the one to demand more from himself."

Manchester United have reportedly initiated talks with Victor Osimhen regarding a potential move to Old Trafford, only to learn subsequently that Viktor Gyokeres has declined the chance to link-up with Ruben Amorim at the club.

United are on the hunt for attacking options and have been evaluating several strikers due to their impressive form in recent seasons. Osimhen and Gyokeres were, according to reports, being closely watched by scouts.

Footmercato reported that the Premier League team have begun negotiations with Osimhen, with an expectation to still chase Gyokeres' signature from Sporting CP. However, reports from Portugal now indicate that the Sweden international spurned the offer to join United, and his representatives have relayed this decision to club higher-ups.
Read more here
Alejandro Garnacho's career at Manchester United has been anything but uneventful.
For all the winger's obvious talent, disciplinary issues have threatened to derail his time at the club on a number of occasions. That threat has now become a reality.

Perhaps the biggest shame in all of this is that Ruben Amorim and Garnacho tried to make it work. After Amorim dropped Garnacho and Marcus Rashford from the Manchester derby squad in December, the latter didn't make another appearance for United and was soon shipped out on loan to Aston Villa. Garnacho went the opposite way, playing a part in every game after the derby victory bar the final day win over Villa.
Read the full piece here
For all the poor decisions and mismanagement at Manchester United, perhaps one of the club's biggest problems is something they can do very little about.

Countless players have arrived at Old Trafford and been swallowed up by the pressure of playing for one of the world's biggest clubs. And when said players ultimately leave United and thrive elsewhere, little consideration is given to the fact their upturn in form may well be down to the reduced pressure levels at clubs where the spotlight isn't quite so intense.

Of course, United might not be able to do anything about the pressure that comes with representing the club, but they can ensure the players they sign are ready to cope with the demands that come with pulling on that famous red shirt.
Read more here
According to ESPN Argentina, Manchester United have began talks with Aston Villa goalkeeper Emi Martinez over a summer move.

Andre Onana faces an uncertain future after a difficult season between the sticks at Old Trafford and it appears that reports in South America are intensifying over the World Cup-winning goalkeeper making the move to M16.
It feels a long time ago that the Ruben Amorim era at Manchester United began with a bang at Portman Road.
Barley two minutes in and Marcus Rashford had scored for the Reds at Ipswich and prompted plenty to wonder whether he might prove the striker beneficiary in the central role in Amorim's set-up.

Within a matter of months, Rashford was on loan at Aston Villa and he has no future at United. The decision to cast him aside is ultimately one for Amorim and it will likely still provoke debate while United continue to struggle in front of goal.
Read more here
Matheus Cunha arrived in Switzerland as a teenager, not speaking the language and taking on the 5,600-mile move solo.

It was a daunting career step to swap Brazil for Sion but for Cunha, this was the right move at the right time. It turned him from South American prospect into a performer on the European stage and set him on a path that this month saw him join Manchester United.
Read the full story here

Manchester United have been handed a blow in their hopes of signing Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres this summer, with the player reportedly ready to turn down the chance of a move to Old Trafford.
The 27-year-old has established himself as one of the most dangerous strikers in Europe since moving to Sporting. In his 102 appearances in the Portuguese league, he has scored 97 goals.
Read more here
Victor Osimhen remains a real option for the Reds, according to claims by United in Focus.
“We’ve known about United and Osimhen for months, and it is genuine interest," claims reporter Graeme Bailey.
"United have known his wage demands and that he is prioritising a move to England for months; he has always wanted a Premier League move."
He added: "He knows United are an option and he wants to come to England."
Read more here
Paul Pogba has received a strong Manchester United response on social media ahead of his potential move to AS Monaco this summer.

The Frenchman, who returned to United in August 2016 for a then record-breaking fee of £89million, is now free to return to professional football after his ban came to an end. Pogba departed Juventus in November, despite having his four-year ban reduced on appeal after testing positive for the prohibited substance DHEA.
Read more here
Andre Onana has admitted he does not know whether he will stay at Manchester United this summer.
The Cameroon international arrived at Old Trafford from Inter Milan back in July 2023. Onana replaced legendary former United stopper David de Gea, who left M16 that summer on a free transfer.
Read more here

Manchester United have reportedly been dealt a blow by Viktor Gyokeres after the Sweden international signalled his intention to sign for Premier League rivals Arsenal. Ruben Amorim brought the forward to Sporting CP with the talisman steering the Portuguese club to back-to-back league titles and a double last term.

The 27-year-old faces a transfer saga this summer with reports suggesting that United, Arsenal and Chelsea are among the clubs vying for Gyokeres' signature. During the first stage of the transfer window, the Old Trafford side welcomed Matheus Cunha as their first signing through the door before expressing an interest in Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo.
Read more here

Bryan Mbeumo has added fuel to the transfer fire on social media, following reports that Tottenham Hotspur want to intercept his proposed move to Manchester United. The Brentford forward is rumoured to be swayed after Spurs announced head coach Thomas Frank as Ange Postecoglou's successor on Thursday.

Earlier this summer, Mbeumo reportedly selected United as his preferred club despite competing interest from Arsenal, Newcastle United and Tottenham. However, this decision was made before Frank left Brentford for North London, and it's suggested that the Dane wants his star player to follow him.
Read more here
Manchester United-linked Gianluigi Donnarumma has recently revealed that he wants to stay with Paris Saint-Germain.
Donnarumma's deal expires next June amid claims that United and Inter Milan have enquired with the 26-year-old's agent, Enzo Raiola, about a potential transfer.
"My priority is to stay at PSG. I don't think there will be problems in the negotiations," he told Sky Italia after the 2-0 win against Moldova.
Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the latest Manchester United transfer news.
The window may currently be closed but United will still be busy behind the scenes, trying to wrap up several deals after a terrible season.
Stay tuned throughout the day for all the latest from Old Trafford!
Gary Pallister has tipped United to sign Liam Delap despite missing out on the Chelsea striker this summer. The former Reds defender said: "Liam Delap is still young.

"He is a prospect but Manchester United need something more ready made in the Premier League. I would have liked to have seen him at Old Trafford, but he is still a name for the future and not yet ready to lead the line for a team like United.

"He’s decided on Chelsea and United have to accept that at the moment the club is not as alluring as it once was given there is no Champions League football, finishing fifth bottom in the Premier League.
"We are now relying on the name alone to attract players..."
Andre Onana has cast doubt over his future at United. The 29-year-old goalkeeper was recently asked if he plans to leave Old Trafford this summer after Ruben Amorim's side missed out on Europe.
He sees his contract expire in June 2028. When quizzed on his future by a reporter from AllezLesLions during the off-season, Onana replied: "Will I leave? I don't know, we'll see!"

During an interview with Viaplay back in May, Thomas Frank was quizzed on Bryan Mbeumo's future. As quoted by the Evening Standard, the former Brentford boss said: "It's clear that if he is to be sold, it must be for a nice, nice amount.

"It is a lot. Mucho. Really a lot. "hen it's clear that it's impossible to replace him one-for-one. It cannot be done. There is a reason why he costs X number of million pounds, and we do not have X number of million pounds to buy for.
"I would say that I would be surprised if a lot of big clubs don't look at him. I would be surprised with what he has to offer. How many wingers score 20 goals for a mid-table club?
"And then with seven assists plus his work-ethic. And his character. All these things mean that he has a lot, so he is a good player."

According to the Mirror, United have already started looking at alternatives to Viktor Gyokeres. The report claims that the Reds are ready to ramp up interest in Hugo Ekitike from Eintracht Frankfurt, who has been heavily linked with a move to Liverpool this summer.
It's said that the Bundesliga outfit wants £80m for the 22-year-old striker. The Mirror reckon that United won't make a bid until the valuation is 'significantly' reduced.

According to The Times, Viktor Gyokeres would prefer a move to Arsenal over United. The report claims the Sporting striker decided he'd rather join Mikel Arteta's side following exploratory talks with the Europa League finalists.

That said, The Times claims that Arsenal are yet to make a decision, with Benjamin Sesko from RB Leipzig also on their shortlist. As it stands, it remains to be seen whether the Gunners push ahead with their bid to sign Gyokeres.

headline: Mbeumo signs, striker chase, £40m exit - what to expect from Man United as transfer window reopens
body: The summer transfer window has officially reopened for business, meaning Manchester United have between now and 7pm on September 1 to get all of their shopping done.

After opening earlier than usual due to an exceptional registration period for the Club World Cup, the window temporarily closed last Tuesday evening, marking a six-day pause in transfer activity. However, it will now remain open without any further interruptions.

Despite a temporary pause, that did not stop United from officially announcing the arrival of Matheus Cunha from Wolves for £62.5million last Thursday. United had announced they had reached an agreement with their Premier League counterparts to sign him on June 1.
Cunha had been a long-term target for United, meaning they are delighted to have secured his signature nice and early. He should be the first of a handful of new recruits at Old Trafford this summer.
In securing Cunha's signature so early, United made their mark on the window quickly, highlighting just how keen they are to show some ambition.

As well as getting a deal in place to sign Cunha prior to the temporary closure, they also made their first move for Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo. They saw an opening offer of £55m turned down just under a fortnight ago but talks between the two clubs remain ongoing.
Mbeumo has informed Brentford's hierarchy that Old Trafford is his preferred destination this summer. However, United are yet to table a second bid for the Cameroon international.

However, since the window temporarily closed last Tuesday, Tottenham Hotspur have also been credited with interest in Mbeumo. That was almost inevitable after Spurs recently appointed Brentford boss Thomas Frank as their new head coach.

Despite having an excellent relationship with Frank, Mbeumo is understood to be determined to move to Old Trafford. United want to strengthen their attacking options this summer and adding the versatile attacker to the addition of Cunha would be a real statement of intent.

It is believed Brentford are holding out for a fee similar to what United paid for Cunha, although the Brazilian was signed via a release clause. United would like to sign Mbeumo ahead of pre-season starting in July.

Elsewhere, United remain determined to sign a striker this summer. After missing out on Liam Delap earlier this month, they have been linked with a crop of alternative options, including the likes of Napoli's Victor Osimhen, Viktor Gyokeres of Sporting Lisbon and most recently Eintracht Frankfurt ace Hugo Ekitike.

Whoever United plan to try and make their first-choice No.9 will be dependent on outgoings. The prospect of signing Mbeumo for a fee in the region of £60m will take their spending past the £120m mark before sanctioning any sales.

United are also keen to sign a midfielder and a goalkeeper this summer. Head coach Ruben Amorim wants a new shot-stopper who can challenge and compete with Andre Onana for the No.1 spot. The addition of a specialist right wing-back is also possible.

Much of what United will be able to do on the incoming front will rest on outgoings. Preparing to oversee up to ten departures, United have a collection of players they would like to offload this summer.

The Reds have identified Marcus Rashford, Jadon Sancho and Antony as priority sales. Each of them spent time out on loan in 2024/25 and United want to offload them permanently ahead of the September 1 deadline.

Rashford is valued at £40m, Antony is available at £32.5m and Sancho could command a fee of somewhere in the region of £20m-£25m after Chelsea paid a £5m penalty clause to break their obligation to sign him permanently.
Alejandro Garnacho has been told he can leave Old Trafford for the right price. Napoli had a £40m bid turned down for him back in January, meaning United are expected to ask for a fee north of £50m.
The former is attracting interest from Inter Milan and it remains to be seen if they will submit a formal offer for the Denmark international. He scored just ten goals for United in 2024/25.

headline: Manchester United should target perfect £50m Bryan Mbeumo alternative Ruben Amorim never gave up on
body: Manchester United remain determined to sign Brentford forward Bryan Mbeumo this summer but a move to Old Trafford is by no means certain.
The 25-year-old is United's top target as Ruben Amorim looks to sign another player to play alongside new signing Matheus Cunha in the two attacking midfield positions in his 3-4-2-1 formation.
United submitted an opening offer of £45million with a further £10million in add-ons for Mbeumo, but it fell short of Brentford’s valuation and talks are continuing between the clubs.
Mbeumo is thought to be keen to join United but until the two clubs reach an agreement his desire to move to Old Trafford remains immaterial.
United would like to wrap up a deal for Mbeumo as soon as possible so he can report for the start of pre-season at Carrington in July.

But Tottenham are also interested in the Cameroon international and his relationship with his former Bees manager Thomas Frank, who has just been appointed as Spurs boss, could prove to be a crucial bargaining chip in their pursuit of the 20-goal forward.
Should United be forced to look elsewhere, then they might look at a player Amorim knows very well from his time as Sporting CP manager.
Using DataMB's player similarity generator tool to bring up players with similar characteristics to Mbeumo, one of the five names to emerge was Sporting star Francisco Trincao.
The Portuguese international was considered one of the brightest young talents in world football when he made the switch from Braga to Barcelona in the summer of 2020.
However, he never really managed to break into the first team and after a loan spell with Wolves, he returned to Portugal to sign for Sporting in the summer of 2022.
There he worked under Amorim for the first time and the United boss managed to tap into the potential that saw Barcelona make their move for the 25-year-old.
Rui Santos, former youth academy co-ordinator at Braga, worked with Trincao at the Portuguese club and explained how Amorim managed to rekindle Trincao's talents in the Portuguese capital.

“We know that Ruben Amorim is a great coach and a great trainer of athletes who have excelled at Sporting. At a time when Francisco Trincão was being criticised, the coach never stopped believing in him. He always supported him,” Santos said.
“In this case, Ruben Amorim was one of the pillars of Trincão’s success. In the past, many people had doubts and now everyone is certain.

“Their rivals in Manchester, and obviously Sporting being a big club, are two of the great giants of football. Furthermore, United has one of Trincão’s ‘fathers’, Ruben Amorim, who has always believed in him. When an athlete is going to take on new projects, he cannot leave aside the financial aspect, but he also has to think about the next step.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

“At Sporting he is having a fabulous return, but here everything is aligned because, in addition to the financial aspect, we have a very important part: working with someone who believed in him when everyone else doubted him.
“Manchester United, Premier League… The Theatre of Dreams came together with the technical team that always believed in him.”
This season saw Trincao score nine goals and register 11 assists in all competitions as Sporting won a domestic double of the league and cup in Portugal.
Trincao is said to have a £50million release clause in his contract, which has two years left to run at the Estadio Jose Alvalade, and shares an agent with United stars Leny Yoro and Manuel Ugarte.

United have done business with his people before and given Amorim's relationship with the player, as well as his impressive goal contribution statistics, they could do far worse than target a move for him as an alternative to Mbeumo.

headline: Eight Manchester United signings show clear transfer plan
body: It's not just at senior level where Manchester United have been active in the transfer market.

The Reds have splashed £62.5million on Matheus Cunha and are chasing a deal for Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo. A host of other players have been linked with a move to Old Trafford as Ruben Amorim reshapes his squad ahead of his first full season in charge.
But there's also been something of a quiet revolution beneath the surface at United, one that is already reaping rewards.

United have long had a tradition of promoting youth and while they have an academy that has produced top tier talent down the years, the Reds are now swooping for talented youngsters from across the globe.
Chido Obi arrived from Arsenal last summer and Ayden Heaven followed in January. The two did not break the bank and have already made their senior breakthrough.

James Overy and Samuel Lusale have also been lured to Manchester with the promise of a pathway to first-team football at Old Trafford. Sixteen-year-old Harley Emsden-James will follow suit when he completes his switch from Southampton.
Sekou Kone (19) was signed from Guidars in Mali and cost £1million. He spent last term bedding in but the club have high hopes for the midfielder.
Enzo Kana-Biyik (18) is set to arrive on a free transfer from French club Le Havre while Diego Leon will complete his switch from South America.
That pair come highly rated after impressing in their respective homelands with Leon potentially costing £7million should add-ons be met.

The strategy is clear - buy young, talented players who can either break into the first team or be sold on at a profit. If United and Amorim have a clear pathway to the senior set-up, then it only encourages prospective players to choose Old Trafford.

headline: Man United eye Bryan Mbeumo alternative as unlikely transfer 'takes step closer'
body: After a brief pause, Manchester United's summer transfer plans kick back into gear today as the window reopens.

The unprecedented early transfer window for the FIFA Club World Cup gave United the opportunity to sign Matheus Cunha earlier than they had anticipated. He has already completed his media obligations and is locked in for 2025/26 and beyond.

Next up for the Reds is to complete the remainder of their business and, in truth, there is a lot to do before the first game of the season. Brentford's Bryan Mbeumo is the top priority this week and while there are some doubts about whether his head has been turned by Tottenham or not, our latest look at the media headlines suggests that United are eyeing themselves an alternative.

According to ESPN, United have identified Crystal Palace's Eberechi Eze as an alternative to Mbeumo should they be unable to complete a deal for the Cameroonian. While Spurs' increasing interest is a factor, it is claimed that CEO Omar Berrada is determined not to pay the 'United Tax' and overspend on the forward.
Last week, there were reports that Tottenham were willing to splash £70m on Mbeumo.

What MEN Sport says: "It is refreshing to see United not being taken for chumps in the transfer window so far. They have been guilty of splashing obscene amounts of money on mediocrity before and while there is no suggestion that Mbeumo is that, there is still a ceiling to what United are willing to pay.

"As for alternatives, Eze already has the seal of approval from one United legend. Paul Scholes is a fan of the Palace man and it is easy to see why. He was arguably their star man last season, he is direct, quick and unlike Mbeumo is a natural in the more central position. The Reds would be on to a good thing if they were to target the Englishman."

Gazzetta dello Sport understands that Inter Milan are pressing ahead with a move for Rasmus Hojlund this summer. They claim that while the Dane has openly admitted to expecting to be at Old Trafford next season, he is 'unhappy' with how his time at United has unfolded.

It is claimed Inter want to bring him to the San Siro and that Hojlund would be open to the move. This week, it is expected that further talks will be held between all parties to discuss the 'formula' of the deal.

What MEN Sport says: "At the end of the 2024/25 season, this transfer looked unlikely at best. And yet, here we are looking at this deal advancing a step closer with talks about the finances regarding the deal. Letting Hojlund leave this summer would guarantee that United need to add another two strikers to their squad this summer.

"This perhaps puts further pressure on United to get a deal done for Viktor Gyokeres amid the drama happening with him in Sporting. Portuguese reports on Sunday reckon that Arsenal are taking a step back so perhaps the time is now for the Reds to strike and finance that move by letting Hojlund go.

headline: Four Man United transfers that can be completed this week as the summer window reopens
body: Manchester United are heading into the second part of the summer transfer window desperate to complete some big deals to help overhaul their squad in Ruben Amorim's image.

Thanks to the exceptional early transfer window, United have already completed one major signing to improve their team. Matheus Cunha arrived from Wolverhampton Wanderers after his £62.5 million release clause was met by the Reds. However, he is not expected to be the last new addition to this squad before the pre-season begins.
With this in mind, MEN Sport has taken a look at four deals that United could complete this week to set themselves up for a busy summer.
Bryan Mbeumo

Perhaps the most likely new addition this week is the Brentford forward. Reports before the weekend suggested that Tottenham Hotspur were keen to add the winger to their squad after appointing his old boss Thomas Frank.

Not only that but Mbeumo was intrigued by the prospect of joining Spurs. However, the Cameroonian's stance for the time being is that he favours a move to United over other teams and that should hopefully give the Reds the edge.
Mbeumo is seen as the club's top target at present and there will be a desire to get that deal done this week before moving on to other priorities.
Marcus Rashford

Should United get the Mbeumo deal over the line, the next priority will be sales to help boost Amorim's transfer pot. Rashford is one of those likely to exit this summer having fallen out with Amorim last winter.

He spent the remainder of the campaign on loan at Aston Villa and while a move to Villa Park permanently appears unlikely, Barcelona have already spoken about their interest in him. Since then, Rashford has been putting in the hard yards to rebuild his fitness following injury and he appears to be in a position again to undergo a medical.
With this being the case, perhaps an exit for Rashford could be sealed this week.
Antony

While Antony has not fallen out with Amorim in the same way that Rashford has, he is still as likely to exit the club. Out of all of those who United are looking to sell, Antony arguably has the highest stock at present.

The Brazilian impressed at Real Betis and reports have claimed that the Seville club are trying to negotiate another deal for the winger this summer. The priority for United will be to sell Antony to reclaim some funds and it will be intriguing to see if this advances further this week.
Rasmus Hojlund

The Danish striker has insisted that he expects to be part of the plans at Old Trafford next season but after such a difficult second season in the Premier League, rumours persist that he could be on the way out of the club. Inter Milan are reportedly the team pushing hard to sign Hojlund and a move to the San Siro could be good for all parties.

It is thought, according to the Italian media, that United want no less than £38m for Hojlund this summer to avoid a PSR (Profit and Sustainability Rules) loss. Whether Inter are willing to reach that mark remains to be seen but they are thought to be very keen on the centre-forward so this deal could accelerate in the next seven days.

headline: Manchester United put on red alert for 27-goal forward amid transfer 'enquiries'
body: Bayer Leverkusen striker Patrick Schick has 'received multiple enquiries' from clubs in the Premier League and Serie A, according to a report by Sky Germany.

The 29-year-old's stock is currently high after he scored 27 goals in 45 appearances for Leverkusen during the 2024/25 campaign. It marked his best season in front of goal since joining the German club from AS Roma in January 2020.
Of his 27 goals, 21 were plundered in the Bundesliga, meaning only Harry Kane scored more goals in the German top flight in the most recent campaign.
Schick has been a fairly reliable source of goals in recent seasons, scoring 81 times in 168 games for Leverkusen. He scored 13 times in 33 games in 2023/24.

With two years remaining on his Leverkusen contract, the Bundesliga outfit, who recently appointed former Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag as their new boss, will not feel pressured into selling the Czech Republic international this summer. It has been claimed that if he does not leave the BayArena, he could be offered a contract extension.

Although the report has not stated which clubs have enquired about signing the striker, who will turn 30 next January, he could be a realistic option for United to try and strengthen the tip of their attack this summer.

The Reds are desperate to recruit a new No.9 and their search currently offers no obvious answer. They are being linked with a catalogue of strikers and the latest to have joined the list is Eintracht Frankfurt ace Hugo Ekitike, who scored 15 Bundesliga goals in 2024/25.
United are also continuing to be heavily linked with Sporting Lisbon star Viktor Gyokeres and Victor Osimhen of Napoli. However, none of the aforementioned players will come cheaply.

However, despite his impressive record in 2024/25, Schick is unlikely to find himself categorised in the same bracket as Ekitike, Gyokeres and Osimhen, not least because he is slightly older and his record in front of goal has not been as prolific in comparison to Gyokeres' and Osimhen's.

Despite scoring 40 goals since the start of the 2023/24 campaign, the 2022/23 season saw him score just four goals in 23 games, although his campaign was ravaged by injury issues. The season prior, though, he scored 24 times in 27 Bundesliga outings.

United, despite signing Matheus Cunha for £62.5million and wanting to sign Bryan Mbeumo from Brentford in a deal that could be worth a similar fee, do not have a bottomless pit to rely on this summer, meaning their hopes of landing a new No.9 are set to rely on raising funds via player sales.

However, Schick is unlikely to command a fee as extravagant as what the likes of Gyokeres, Osimhen or Ekitike would. On the flip side, though, the Leverkusen striker is not held as high esteem as the aforementioned trio and will turn 30 next year.

headline: Man United have four players seeking future clarity - Ruben Amorim has to get two big calls right
body: Manchester United's line up for their Premier League season opener remains anyone's guess as they continue to chase targets in the transfer market.

A striker remains the top priority as United seek to cure their failings in front of goal. The Reds have added Matheus Cunha to their ranks and if Bryan Mbeumo follows then those two will surely lock out the two attacking 10s in Ruben Amorim's set-up.
The pair are versatile to perform in other roles but look a natural fit to play off a frontman.
Should the duo arrive, there will be a knock-on effect elsewhere. Indeed United have a plethora of players for who some positional clarity is needed.

Bruno Fernandes will get into the XI but that looks increasingly likely to be in the central midfield position now. Is that where Mason Mount's future is? Or will he be a back-up further forward. That looks his natural habitat but he has the capabilities and the intelligence to play deeper.
Amad surely must be in the team but is that now be at right wing back? He was a brilliant performer last season and a role must be found for him.

Kobbie Mainoo made his England breakthrough in the middle of midfield, but can play as an attack minded role and even filled in up front last term. He is now one of several options in a crowded position.
The youngster might benefit from his ability to play multiple positions but you get the sense that for his career to kick on, a natural home is needed.

Amorim has spoken of having versatile players capable of playing across positions. There is plenty of merit to that argument, but certainly in the cases of young pair Mainoo and Amad, they must be given some clarity to thrive.

headline: Manchester United have £7m forgotten signing arriving next month who's been compared to Wayne Rooney
body: Manchester United have made an eye-catching start to the summer transfer window by securing the arrival of Matheus Cunha from Wolverhampton Wanderers.
The Brazilian international officially joined United earlier this week and after scoring 17 goals for Wolves last season he should add some much needed firepower to the club's ranks.
Cunha will slot into one of the attacking midfield roles in Ruben Amorim's 3-4-2-1 system and United are hopeful Brentford star Bryan Mbeumo will also arrive to play alongside him.

The Cameroon international scored 20 goals in the Premier League last season and is keen on a move to United. Tottenham and Newcastle are also said to be interested with the Bees holding out for their asking price for the 25-year-old.
But it is perhaps a summer signing that was agreed back in January that could prove to be one of the biggest steals of this window.
United announced the signing of Paraguayan left-back Diego Leon for an initial £3.3million that could rise to £7million in add-ons and he will officially join the club on July 1.
In that time, the 18-year-old has continued to play regularly for Cerro Porteno in the Paraguayan top flight, picking up invaluable experience of first team football.
There is a lot of excitement about his ceiling back in his homeland and it has perhaps gone under the radar that he will eventually make the move to Old Trafford in just 16 days' time.
Manchester United have launched their new home kit for the 2025/26 season with an Adidas shirt paying tribute to Old Trafford.
Fans can order their Men's, Women's and Kid's shirt today.

Nobody is expecting him to match the heights of United's record goalscorer, not least because they play in different positions, but the parallels between Leon's impact on senior football at such a tender age and his look and stature with Rooney's meteoric rise at Everton are there for all to see.
Leon plays as a left-wing-back and he will, of course, have to force his way past Patrick Dorgu, Luke Shaw and Harry Amass in the pecking order.

It is more likely he will play with the under-21s to begin with but Amorim has shown he is not afraid to throw in youngsters when they are ready, handing debuts to teenagers Amass, Chido Obi, Tyler Fredricson and Ayden Heaven this season.
If Leon can deliver on his promise it will be the first success story of Ineos prioritising the signing of young players with high potential and low transfer fees.
And that prospect should excite United fans.

headline: What Matheus Cunha said about Manchester United problem bodes well
body: For all the poor decisions and mismanagement at Manchester United, perhaps one of the club's biggest problems is something they can do very little about.

Countless players have arrived at Old Trafford and been swallowed up by the pressure of playing for one of the world's biggest clubs. And when said players ultimately leave United and thrive elsewhere, little consideration is given to the fact their upturn in form may well be down to the reduced pressure levels at clubs where the spotlight isn't quite so intense.

Of course, United might not be able to do anything about the pressure that comes with representing the club, but they can ensure the players they sign are ready to cope with the demands that come with pulling on that famous red shirt.
In Matheus Cunha, they have signed a player who is all too used to being under the spotlight.

While Wolves may not be the biggest team in England, two-and-a-half years spent in the Premier League after a stint in La Liga with Atletico Madrid along with 15 caps for Brazil mean he is ready for what's about to come his way.

"I'm so free for that (the pressure that comes with playing for United), honestly. I think I'm grateful to be part of the biggest national team in the world, the pressure there is also huge," he told MUTV. "And I learned a lot. I learned a lot, I think in the beginning it was a little bit different in parts for me.

"To be honest, sometimes I don't think I managed well and I think I learned from the mistakes. I don't think it's mistakes, it's normal, it's learning. To come here now is the best moment in my life to also feel open for these kind of details."

The final part of that answer is also telling. One of the reservations some fans have had over Cunha is his disciplinary record. He was suspended for a combined six matches last season following a full-time scuffle with an Ipswich Town security guard and a red card at Bournemouth. He admits he's learnt a lot in his career so far and is ready for the challenge.
At 26, Cunha is coming into his prime and his 15 Premier League goals last season suggest United have got themselves a real quality player.

With experience of playing in the Premier League, experience of playing in some of Europe's other top leagues and a relatively modest fee of £62.5m for a player who should fit seamlessly into Ruben Amorim's system, it really does feel like the only thing that could get in Cunha's way is the pressure of playing for United.
He wouldn't be the first player to crumble but he's confident that he won't.

headline: Man United get surprise Viktor Gyokeres boost as transfer saga takes another twist
body: Manchester United could have potentially moved back ahead of Arsenal in their mooted pursuit of Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres as the Gunners reportedly get ready to "freeze" their interest.

Earlier this week, the Swede's seemingly drama-free exit from the Portuguese team took a twist when Sporting's president Frederico Varandas denied that he agreed to let Gyokeres leave for £51million, plus £8.5million in add-ons. Gyokeres' camp hit back that they had this gentleman's agreement in writing, but Sporting have been holding firm that he will only leave for the release clause of £68million in his contract.

While this has been going on, Arsenal have reportedly been looking to force through a deal for less than that fee. However, despite the striker appearing to be unhappy with the situation, the Lisbon club have stuck to their guns.

Now, reports in Portugal suggest Arsenal have reached their breaking point and are now freezing their pursuit of the striker. Record understands that the Gunners are now looking at different options to strengthen their forward line for Mikel Arteta next season.

RB Leipzig's Benjamin Sesko is currently at the top of Arsenal's list, while Aston Villa's Ollie Watkins is also thought to be an option if Gyokeres can't be purchased. In the meantime, this is all good news for United, who are eager to add a centre-forward to their attack.

Ruben Amorim reportedly still regards Gyokeres as his "top target" for this summer after the pair enjoyed a fruitful relationship at Sporting before United swooped in for the head coach. The 27-year-old would arguably be ideal for United considering he knows the system Amorim wants to play, plus his goal-scoring record in Portugal is fantastic.

Since leaving Coventry City for Portugal, Gyokeres has scored an astounding 97 goals in 102 appearances across all competitions. This includes six in eight Champions League matches and five in nine Europa League games.

headline: Victor Osimhen to Man United transfer decision made hours before Viktor Gyokeres answer
body: Manchester United have reportedly initiated talks with Victor Osimhen regarding a potential move to Old Trafford, only to learn subsequently that Viktor Gyokeres has declined the chance to link-up with Ruben Amorim at the club.

United are on the hunt for attacking options and have been evaluating several strikers due to their impressive form in recent seasons. Osimhen and Gyokeres were, according to reports, being closely watched by scouts.

Footmercato reported that the Premier League team have begun negotiations with Osimhen, with an expectation to still chase Gyokeres' signature from Sporting CP. However, reports from Portugal now indicate that the Sweden international spurned the offer to join United, and his representatives have relayed this decision to club higher-ups.

Eager for a fresh start, Gyokeres has hinted at possible drastic measures to secure an exit. He shared on Instagram: "There is a lot of talks at the moment, most of it is false. I will speak when the time is right."
Last season, Gyokeres, who has experience in English football with Coventry and Swansea, surpassed the 50-goal mark while playing in Portugal. In his two-year stint, he's managed 97 goals.

On the other hand, Osimhen has just completed a successful loan spell in Turkey, contributing significantly to Galatasaray's championship win with 37 goals, which has attracted further interest in him. As Arsenal also keeps tabs on the Sporting sensation, it's clear that neither Osimhen nor Gyokeres would be let go without commanding substantial transfer fees.
Sporting president Frederico Varandas has made a firm statement regarding the transfer speculation surrounding Gyokeres.

"It was agreed that Sporting would not demand his release clause at the end of the season, especially because he was going to be 27," Varandas said. "We knew about Viktor's dream of going to a club where he could fight for the Champions League and we have common sense.
"We guaranteed that we would not demand €100million. Sporting has common sense, it keeps its word.
"The president of Sporting said that the club would not demand the clause and that we would adjust the value to Viktor's performance, he was one of the best players to step on the pitch in Portugal."

Former United star Rio Ferdinand has said this week that the club should've prioritised a move for Osimhen ahead of Gyokeres, with the Nigerian no longer wanted by Napoli despite his impressive strike-rate.
He said: "I think Gyokeres, everyone's talking about him. Again, I think if I'm looking at the market now, and I had to pick him or Osimhen, I'd probably pick Osimhen because of that experience."

"He's shown he's done it in multiple leagues now. And he's done it internationally, as well. I think he's a top-class number nine who, again, the young players will be able to learn from. I'm not saying that Gyokeres would fail. I'm just saying that if I had a preference, then I would go there."

headline: Manchester United's rivals have done them a £30m favour despite transfer U-turn
body: Jadon Sancho won't play for Manchester United again but the club still need to find a way to ship him out of Old Trafford on a permanent basis.
The former Borussia Dortmund man was expected to make his temporary switch to Chelsea permanent this summer but the Stamford Bridge outfit have pulled out of the agreed £25million deal.
It leaves United in a tricky position, saddled with a player who won't play for them again and the club not exactly inundated with calls from potential suitors.

While Chelsea's U-turn on Sancho has added another task to an already extensive list in the market for United this summer, the London club may well have done United a massive favour with one of their other transfer decisions.

Ruben Amorim is desperate to add a goalscorer to his squad this summer. Rasmus Hojlund and Joshua Zirkzee only mustered seven league goals between them last season as United managed just 44 goals in the Premier League. Their blunt attack was a massive contributing factor to a dire season.

Looking at potential when searching for a forward to lead the line at a club of United's stature clearly isn't working, making their pursuit of former Manchester City forward Liam Delap particularly concerning.
Delap enjoyed a very encouraging first season in the Premier League, scoring 12 goals in a poor Ipswich Town team.

However, when you consider he is just four days Hojlund's junior and the Dane himself managed to hit nine goals in Serie A in the season prior to his move to United in 2023, their records and profiles aren't dissimilar.
Despite United looking set to trigger the £30m release clause in Delap's Ipswich contract, Chelsea swooped for the 22-year-old and completed a deal.

Even if he goes on to thrive at Chelsea, United are in a far worse position than the fourth-best team in last season's Premier League who also lifted the Europa Conference League trophy, and so there would still be no guarantees it would have worked out had he moved to Old Trafford.
Chelsea's Sancho snub isn't good news for United but their move for Delap might be.

headline: Emi Martinez to Man United transfer update emerges as £85m 'interest' ramped up
body: Manchester United are continuing their search for reinforcements following last season's torrid performance in the Premier League. Matheus Cunha is already through the door while reports suggest they face a battle to land Bryan Mbeumo with Tottenham Hotspur rumoured to also hold an interest in the Brentford winger.

Ruben Amorim has an important summer on the horizon as they are without European football with their focus on the top-flight, FA Cup and League Cup. On Saturday, speculation suggested that Viktor Gyokeres had turned down a move to Old Trafford in favour of a switch to Premier League rivals Arsenal.
The MEN has taken a look at the latest transfer news and gossip.
According to ESPN Argentina, Manchester United have began talks with Aston Villa goalkeeper Emi Martinez over a summer move.

Andre Onana faces an uncertain future after a difficult season between the sticks at Old Trafford and it appears that reports in South America are intensifying over the World Cup-winning goalkeeper making the move to the North West.
"Talks have already begun, contacts so that Martinez can join Manchester United," Leo Paradizo said on ESPNF10.
"Of all the possibilities that he has in his immediate future, Manchester United is the one that excites him the most.
"The clubs are going to take their time, but yes, I can confirm that the contact between Manchester United and Martinez have already started."
He followed up in a tweet: "Dibu Martínez already knows that Manchester United wants him in goal next season.
"Onana will leave, and they're going after the Argentina national team goalkeeper."

MEN says: The goalkeeping department is one of the number of positions that United need to strengthen in the summer and it quickly became clear that Onana's struggles were having a significant bearing on the campaign. However, without any real competition, the shot-stopper kept his place in the first-team. If United want to find themselves at the top end of the table, they need to rectify their goalkeeping struggles and the arrival of a Premier League-proven goalkeeper like Martinez would go a long way. However, it's worth bearing in mind he will be suspended for the start of the season after his red card at Old Trafford.
According to various reports, Man United are set to miss out on Gyokeres after the Sweden international expressed his desire to move to the Premier League and to the Emirates Stadium.
It was claimed that Amorim's side held exploratory talks with the 27-year-old over a blockbuster summer move as they look to improve their attacking department.
However, it has been suggested that United could turn their attention from the Swede to Eintracht Frankfurt striker Hugo Ekitike.
United reportedly face competition from Chelsea and Liverpool for the France attacker.
The Mirror have reported that Amorim's side are ready to ramp up interest in the 22-year-old after receiving news of Gyokeres' preference.

MEN says: It will be a blow to lose out on a striker who has scored 92 goals in 104 appearances, especially with Amorim bringing him to the Portuguese top-flight. United have already missed out on Liam Delap and the reports surrounding their latest disappointment will only add pressure to their hunt to fire attacking reinforcements. Ekitike is said to be courting interest from around Europe already and the Premier League with Frankfurt wanting around £85m for a player with his prime years ahead of him he could be a good piece of business. However, United have been found guilty of overspending in the past which has come back to haunt them.

headline: Man United identify Viktor Gyokeres transfer alternative after final decision made
body: Manchester United have reportedly decided on their transfer alternative to Sporting Lisbon's Viktor Gyokeres, who has his heart set on a move to Arsenal.
The Swedish forward believes he needs to join a club competing in the Champions League next season and vying for the Premier League title.

United insiders have declined to comment on Portuguese reports suggesting the 27 year-old has expressed disinterest in reuniting with his ex-Sporting coach Ruben Amorim in Manchester, reports the Mirror.
However, it is believed that the Reds have already begun scouting for alternative targets - and are prepared to intensify their pursuit of Eintracht Frankfurt's Hugo Ekitike.
Ekitike, a 22 year-old France Under-21 international, has also caught Liverpool's eye after netting 22 goals for the German side last season.
However, Frankfurt's £80 million asking price for the former Paris St Germain forward would need to be significantly reduced before United make an offer.

United have already been told that they will have to come up with an acceptable offer for Frankfurt, with the club's sporting director Markus Krosche telling Wiesbadener Kurier: "If the price isn't right, then he'll simply stay with us. We don't have to sell Hugo."

As for Gyokeres, the transfer saga around the Sweden striker has taken many twists and turns this week. On Thursday he took to the social media platform Instagram to break his silence on mounting speculation on his future, saying: "There is a lot of talk at the moment, most of it is false.
"I will speak when the time is right."

His comments came after Sporting president Frederico Varandas gave his understanding of the situation around a supposed 'gentleman's agreement' for the player to leave for around £60m instead of his £84m release clause.

"I can guarantee that Viktor Gyokeres will not leave for 60m euros plus 10m euros because I never promised that," Varandas said. "To this day, Sporting has not received an offer for Gyokeres - neither today nor last summer."

headline: Man Utd star’s exit to reunite with former boss ‘complicated’ due to preference
body: Transfer insider Fabrizio Romano has revealed that Alejandro Garnacho leaving Manchester United to reunite with a former boss will be “complicated.”

Garnacho’s future is almost certain to be away from United. He caused a stir when he complained about having a small role in the Europa League final – which United lost – and then called the season sh*t.
Following that, on the Red Devils’ post-season tour of Southeast Asia, Ruben Amorim reportedly told him: “You better pray that you can find a club to sign you.”

It has since been reported that the United boss has weakened the club’s negotiating position, as sides are aware he wants rid of Garnacho, so won’t pay the asking price, aware the Manchester outfit will probably accept less than they’d initially hoped for.
One of the sides interested in Garnacho are Bayer Leverkusen, with Erik ten Hag – who managed the winger at Old Trafford – recently becoming their boss.
According to transfer insider Romano, that move to reunite the pair will not be an easy one to be pulled off.

He said on X that Garnacho’s ‘priority is to remain in the Premier League,’ while he’s expected to leave United. Despite Leverkusen’s ‘interest and and Ten Hag’s appreciation, the deal looks complicated’.

It has previously been suggested that Chelsea is the United man’s preferred destination. Indeed, he has reportedly told his agent to make it clear that he’d like to land at Stamford Bridge this summer.
But Romano has reported there’s not a massively high chance that move goes through. He recently stated there is a ’35 per cent chance’ that Garnacho does move to the Blues.
In the same report, he suggested the United man ‘could stay in the Premier League’.
Indeed, that is his preference, but if no clubs in England make an offer, but sides elsewhere offer United what they want, it seems they will waste no time in getting Garnacho off the books.
Whether that is Leverkusen remains to be seen, as the likes of Napoli, AC Milan and Atletico Madrid have all been linked with the Argentine, too.
A rant from Ruben Amorim has reportedly ‘weakened’ the negotiating position of Manchester United for one of their players, meaning his value might have dropped by £20million.
Man Utd have to get busy with new signings but confidence in their ability to raise money through sales seems as woefully misplaced as ever.
Fabrizio Romano has revealed the precise chances that a Manchester United man joins Chelsea, as he has reiterated that the star ‘will leave’ the club.
According to reports, Manchester City star Jack Grealish is being ‘lined up’ for a move overseas and could impact one Liverpool transfer this summer.
Man Utd legend Cristiano Ronaldo ‘demanded’ that Al-Nassr signed Alejandro Garnacho this summer during his contract negotiations, according to reports.
According to reports, Arsenal are among the clubs interested in signing Manchester United winger Alejandro Garnacho, who has been linked with Chelsea.

headline: Man Utd: Rio Ferdinand sets PL ‘finish’ target for Ruben Amorim next season in ‘big come-down’
body: Manchester United legend Rio Ferdinand has set a Premier League “finish” target for head coach Ruben Amorim heading into next season.
The Red Devils are reeling from a dour 2024/25 campaign as they failed to win a trophy and finished 15th in the Premier League.
Man Utd‘s poor performances reached a new low after Amorim replaced former head coach Erik ten Hag and he struggled to implement his preferred 3-4-3 formation.
Amorim has a massive job in the coming months as he looks to build a team capable of competing for Europe as they were miles away from achieving this feat in 24/25.

Man Utd are already active in the transfer market and it would boost their prospects if they land their standout targets, but Ferdinand has set a “finish” target for Amorim to pursue next season with Champions League qualification already ruled out.
“I think if you finish 15th this year, United have got to be looking to finish in at least the top eight, top six,” Ferdinand told The Mirror.
READ: Top 10 available goalkeepers for Man Utd and Chelsea to fight over this summer
“I don’t think you should be looking outside of that.
“And that’s from someone who only thought about winning the league at United. So it’s a big come-down in that sense.”

Most of United’s summer budget will likely go on a new striker and they are linked with several potential targets. Ferdinand has explained why he thinks they should snub Viktor Gyokeres for an alternative.
“[Man United need] a centre-forward with experience. That’s it. I think United can go and get a lot of players and get loads of stuff,” Ferdinand said.
“But I think it’s been evident that [Rasmus] Hojlund came in for huge money and hasn’t hit the ground running, has struggled really. [Joshua] Zirkzee hasn’t done much better than him, really.

“So, I think you need someone in all the good teams you see. They normally have at least one of the attacking players, normally the number nine. And you go, actually, yeah, I can pin my hat on him. I can rely on him.

“And I think Hojlund’s lack of experience has been a big factor. So, a striker, I don’t want any striker. I think I’ve said it on my podcast many times. I think a striker with experience, knows his right way around the football field, who the young ones they’ve invested in, like Hojlund and Zirkzee and Chido [Obi] can learn from.”

On Gyokeres, he added: “I think Gyokeres, everyone’s talking about him. Again, I think if I’m looking at the market now and I had to pick him or [Victor] Osimhen, I’d probably pick Osimhen because of that experience.

“And he’s shown he’s done it in multiple leagues now. And he’s done it internationally as well. I think he’s a top-class number nine who, again, the young players will be able to learn from. I’m not saying that Gyokeres would fail. I’m just saying that if I had a preference, I would go there.”
A rant from Ruben Amorim has reportedly ‘weakened’ the negotiating position of Manchester United for one of their players, meaning his value might have dropped by £20million.
According to reports, Aston Villa are involved in a ‘three-way Premier League battle’ to sign Manchester United outcast Jadon Sancho.
Man Utd legend Rio Ferdinand insists that Sporting CP striker Viktor Gyokeres is not “the guy” to score goals for the Red Devils next season.
Spurs will have to part with £10m to secure first-choice Ange Postecoglou replacement Thomas Frank and challenge Chelsea’s manager compensation monopoly.
Ruben Amorim has made his decision on whether to sell Man Utd defender Lisandro Martinez this summer, according to reports.
Man Utd have ‘made contact’ with Sporting over a move for Viktor Gyokeres as Ruben Amorim is ‘poised to win the battle’ for the £59m striker.
